core, & distributes itself thence like
a paralysing venom, through the
affections into the very appetites;
till all become a torpid mass in
which sense hardly survives. At
the approach of such a period, Poetry
itself to
ever addresses those faculties which
are the last to be destroyed, & its
voice is heard, like the footsteps
of Astraea departing from the world.
Poetry ever communicates all the pleasure
which men are capable of recieving: it
is ever still the light of life; the
source of whatever beautiful or generous
or true can have place in an evil time.
It will readily be confessed that those
among the luxurious citizens of
Syracuse & Alexandria who were delighted
with the poems of Theocritus, were
